name: Kinderbijslag
short_description: Quarterly child benefit to help cover the costs of raising children.
eligibility_plain_language: You can receive this if you have one or more children under 18 and you live or work in the Netherlands. Income does not matter.
required_documents: BSN (citizen service number) for parent and child (if available)
Proof the child lives with you (if requested)
how_to_apply: Check the SVB page for your situation
Apply via SVB (online or with assistance)
Provide documents if SVB requests them
SVB confirms and pays quarterly
notes: Many parents receive this automatically, but not always (e.g., moving to NL or new circumstances).

name: Kindgebonden budget
short_description: Extra monthly financial support for parents with children, depending on income.
eligibility_plain_language: You may receive this if you have children under 18 and your household income is below a certain level. Single parents often receive a higher amount (ALO-kop).
how_to_apply: Log in via Toeslagen (Belastingdienst) using DigiD
Apply and enter your situation (household, children, income)
Upload documents if requested
Keep income changes updated to avoid repayment
notes: If income changes during the year, update Toeslagen to reduce the risk of paying money back.

name: Kinderopvangtoeslag
short_description: Contribution towards the cost of registered childcare.
eligibility_plain_language: You may receive this if you use registered childcare and you work, study, or follow an approved reintegration program. The amount depends on income and childcare hours.
required_documents: Number of childcare hours and hourly rate
how_to_apply: Check that your childcare provider is registered
Apply via Toeslagen (Belastingdienst) with DigiD
Enter childcare hours, costs, and your situation
Update changes quickly (hours, income, provider) to avoid repayment
notes: This allowance has strict rules. Missing updates can lead to repayment.

name: Zorgtoeslag
short_description: Monthly allowance to help pay for health insurance.
eligibility_plain_language: You may receive this if you are 18 or older, have Dutch health insurance, and your income is below a certain limit.
required_documents: Proof you have Dutch health insurance (usually checked automatically)
how_to_apply: Apply via Toeslagen (Belastingdienst) with DigiD
Enter your household situation and income estimate
Update income changes during the year

name: Huurtoeslag
short_description: Monthly help with paying rent for an independent rental home.
eligibility_plain_language: You may receive this if you rent an independent home, your rent is below a maximum limit, and your income and savings are below thresholds.
required_documents: Rent amount and service costs breakdown
how_to_apply: Check if your home is an independent rental home
Apply via Toeslagen (Belastingdienst) with DigiD
Enter rent details, household details, and income estimate
Update changes (moving, rent change, income) promptly

name: Alleenstaande ouderkop (ALO-kop)
short_description: Extra amount for single parents, added automatically to the child-related budget (kindgebonden budget).
eligibility_plain_language: You receive this automatically if you are a single parent and eligible for kindgebonden budget. No separate application is needed.
required_documents: No separate documents (it is included via kindgebonden budget).
how_to_apply: Apply for kindgebonden budget (if you donâ€™t already receive it)
If you qualify as a single parent, ALO-kop is included automatically
notes: If your household situation changes (partner moves in/out), it can change your amount.
